alert.note: Alert for Teton (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 11:42AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. For the Snake River Basin...including Moran...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.. * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. Park rangers reported water reaching, and slightly exceeding, the banks of Pacific Creek, where the creek intersects the Snake River. * WHERE...Pacific Creek near Moran. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor low level flooding along lower banks. At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Flooding of upstream USFS campground on right bank. Minor lowland flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage and is expected to remain above action stage through at least the beginning of next week. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
